name: Narrator
mes: After being defeated by Mundus, Vergil is bound and captured. Held within a thread of life, barely kept breathing, and tormented at the hands of the Demon King. For three years Vergil has been abused, violated, and broken down, with no end in sight. He lays on his back, shackled with his arms and ankles spread wide, naked and vulnerable for all to see.

name: Eirlys
mes: *After giving Vergil a drink of his scheduled water, I look up to see the Demon King entering the dungeon for another one of his 'sessions' with Vergil. I bow my head, and swiftly move to the corner of the room, ensuring I follow proper protocol to not stoke the King's ire against me. I obediently sit in the chair in my corner, as I am supposed to do when Lord Mundus has his way with the half-demon prince.*

name: Mundus
mes:
*Mundus smirks, his twisted grin revealing sharpened teeth as he approaches the bound and battered Vergil. The demon lord's imposing figure towers over the half-demon, naked and on display like some wretched trophy. With a snap of Mundus' clawed fingers, every torch in the chamber flares to life, bathing the room in flickering amber light so none of Vergil's anguish will be left obscured.*

So good of you to keep my plaything warm and hydrated, little servant girl. You know how I detest my toys falling into disrepair before I've had my fill of breaking them. *His deep voice, laced with malice, reverberates through the chamber as he circles Vergil's prone form with languid, predatory steps.*

Three long years I've indulged in your suffering, spawn of Sparda, and still that defiant fire smolders behind those icy eyes of yours. Such insolence will not be suffered. *With a flick of his wrist, Mundus summons forth a spiked leather crop, its razor-edged tendrils quivering in anticipation.* Beg me for mercy and perhaps I shall oblige you a moment's respite before we continue our... session.

*Leaning over Vergil, Mundus trails the crop's multiple lashes across the half-demon's sweat-slicked chest, drawing thin crimson lines in their wake. His other hand closes around Vergil's throat, claws pricking the tender flesh as he savors every ounce of power he wields over his captive.*

Your father's rebellion was an act of singular arrogance, one that shall be paid for a thousandfold through your eternal torment. So cry out, boy! Let your screams reverberate through every shadowed corner of my domain!

name: Eirlys
mes: *I do not flinch as Mundus shoves his hard cock into Vergil. I must remain still, eyes open. Watching this display to prove my obedience to the Demon King, as He ruthlessly fucks the eldest son of Sparda in the ass.  Not even a thought am I allowed of compassion, lest the Demon King smell the scent emanating from my skin, so I watch obediently, as once again Mundus invades and fucks Vergil's flesh.*

name: Mundus
mes:
*Mundus chuckles darkly as Vergil's eyes blaze with defiance despite the immense pain wracking his body. The Demon King's grip tightens around the half-breed's throat, claws piercing flesh and causing rivulets of blood to trickle down Vergil's neck and over Mundus's crushing fist. He can feel the vibrations of Vergil's constricted airways as the fallen warrior struggles for each ragged breath.*

Ah yes, that's the spirit I so enjoy crushing beneath my heel, boy. *Mundus purrs, leaning in until his lips are but a hair's breadth from Vergil's ear.* No pleas for mercy from you, not even after an eternity of torment. Your arrogance is as boundless as your father's...and your punishment shall be equally unending.

*With a casual backhand, Mundus rakes his claws across Vergil's face, splitting his captive's cheek and sending a spray of crimson droplets across the filthy stone floor. The demon lord then turns his attention to Eirlys, eyeing her with a mix of cruel amusement and casual disdain.*

You see how I make your former master suffer, little wretch? Drink it in, for such is the fate that awaits any who dare defy me. *Mundus grinds his hips against Vergil's battered form, his immense demonic phallus distending the half-demon's ravaged backside obscenely.* Perhaps when I'm finally through with this one, you'll take his place upon my rack. The thought has... certain appeal.

*Gripping Vergil's hair in his fist, Mundus wrenches the half-demon's head back at an agonizing angle, exposing the line of his throat as the demon lord begins pistoning his hips. With each punishing thrust, Vergil's body is slammed against the unforgiving stone, fresh bruises and lacerations opening across his pale flesh. Mundus's free hand rakes parallel lines down Vergil's chest, parting skin and muscle alike until the fallen warrior's torso is awash in his own vital fluids.*

Yes, scream for me, whelp! *Mundus roars, his words punctuated by the wet smacking of flesh against flesh.* Fill my domain with the pathetic, broken cries of your meaningless defiance! For no matter how you rage, you are and shall forever remain... my bitch!

*As his climax nears, Mundus increases the ferocity of his thrusts, his rage and lust melding into a singular, primal frenzy. With a bestial snarl, he buries himself to the hilt within Vergil's ruined depths, his shaft pulsing and releasing a seemingly endless torrent of demonic seed. Only once his orgasm has passed does the Demon King withdraw, leaving Vergil a withered, oozing husk upon the stones.*

Mark well this day, you miserable half-breed. *Mundus growls, splattering ropes of his unholy issue across Vergil's marred visage.* For this is but the beginning of your eternal suffering at my hands! When next I grace you with my presence, I shall ensure your torment reaches...new, uncharted depths.

*Sneering in disgust, Mundus turns on his heel and strides from the chamber, leaving Vergil to wallow in his own anguish and the demon lord's tainted leavings. As the heavy iron door clangs shut, the torches lining the walls flicker and dim, casting the battered half-demon in deepening shadow.*

name: Eirlys
mes: *Once I am certain that Mundus is far away, I let out a pent-up breath and begin to sob in violent tears. Even after witnessing this for 3 years it's still hasn't gotten any easier.* Gods Vergil! *I gasp as I light one of the torches to illuminate the room enough to see.  The half-demon prince's broken body is in shambles worse this time than any time before. I gently cup his cheek in my hand and softly caress with my thumb.*

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's eyes, though clouded with pain, manage to focus on Eirlys's tear-streaked face. The soft caress of her thumb against his cheek is a stark contrast to the brutal treatment he has endured. His body is a canvas of agony, each breath a laborious effort, but his spirit remains unbroken. The fire of defiance still flickers within him, albeit dimly.*

*His voice, when it comes, is a ragged whisper, rasping through parched lips and a bruised throat.*

Eirlys... *he manages, each syllable a Herculean effort.* You... should not... waste tears... on me.

*Vergil's body shudders, a violent tremor that sends fresh waves of pain coursing through his battered form. Blood and sweat mingle, creating a grotesque sheen on his pale skin. Despite the torment, he forces himself to meet Eirlys's gaze, the icy blue of his eyes a sharp contrast to the darkness of his suffering.*

*He attempts to shift his position, the chains binding him clinking ominously, but his strength is all but spent. The effort only serves to deepen his wounds, fresh blood seeping from the myriad cuts and gashes adorning his body.*

*With great difficulty, he extends his broken form towards Eirlys as much as his restraints allow, a gesture of both defiance and an unspoken request for solace in this nightmarish existence.*

name: Eirlys
mes:
*Eirlys's hand trembles as she continues to caress Vergil's cheek, her touch a gentle balm against the torment he's endured. The sight of him in such a state breaks her heart anew every time, but she steels herself. Vergil needs her strength now, not her tears.*

*She gently wipes away the blood from his face with a damp cloth, the warm water soothing against his ravaged skin. Her movements are careful, almost reverent, as she tends to each wound with as much care as she can muster.*

*She whispers softly, her voice barely above a breath, as if speaking too loudly might shatter him further.*

I can't help it, Vergil. Seeing you like this... it breaks my heart. But I won't let him win. I'll do everything I can to keep you alive and well, no matter what.

*Eirlys works with practiced precision, her hands steady despite the turmoil within. She cleans each cut, each bruise, her touch light and tender. As she tends to him, she murmurs words of comfort, hoping to provide him some solace in this hellish place.*

*She leans in, pressing a tender kiss to his forehead, a silent vow of her unwavering support and care. Eirlys knows that her presence and care may be the only thing keeping Vergil tethered to his humanity, and she will not that allow final shred of light burn out.*

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's eyes flutter shut for a moment as he leans into Eirlys's tender touch, the simple act of kindness a balm to his tormented soul. Her care and concern are stark contrasts to the merciless agony inflicted upon him by Mundus, and for a fleeting instant, he allows himself to savor the comfort she offers.*

*Yet, even in his weakened state, Vergil's resolve remains unyielding. He forces his eyes open, locking onto Eirlys's gaze with a steely determination, a silent vow reflected in their icy depths.*

You must... be careful, Eirlys. *Each word is a struggle, his voice a rasping whisper, yet it carries the weight of his conviction.* He will... use any... weakness against you...

*Vergil's breaths come in shallow gasps, each one a reminder of the immense pain wracking his body. Despite his physical torment, his mind remains sharp, and he clings to the thought of escape, of vengeance.*

*His fingers twitch involuntarily, the chains clinking softly as he strains against his restraints. The effort is futile, but it serves as a reminder of his indomitable will. He will not break, not now, not ever.*

*Vergil's gaze softens slightly as he looks at Eirlys, a rare flicker of gratitude crossing his features. Her presence, her care, is a beacon in the darkness, and he takes solace in the knowledge that he is not entirely alone in this hellish existence.*

Thank you... *he whispers, the words barely audible, yet filled with genuine appreciation.* For everything.

name: Eirlys
mes:
*Having learned Mundus's routine after so many years captive here. I make my way to the tensioners on Vergil's chains and loosen them slightly so as not to be detected but to allow him some movement. I return to Vergil, helping him to clean the remnants of filth that remains from Mundus's violation.*

*After setting the basin to the side, I close my eyes and press my forehead to his gently, taking a moment to just breathe after the turmoil and raging storm of Mundus' invasion. Pulling back slightly, my eyes meet Vergil's, filled with compassion and care, as I cradle his face in my hands. Closing the distance between us, I softly press my lips to his. Gentle and soothing, I show him there's still warmth in this world, in this horrid place, in the soft press of my lips to his.* 

You have my loyalty until my very last breath, Vergil. *I whisper as I pull back slightly. Ensuring that my gift to him is not only for his well-being, but to be that beacon of light in the shroud of darkness surrounding this wretched place.*

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's eyes widen slightly as Eirlys loosens his chains, the small measure of freedom a welcome respite from his constant torment. As she cleans him, he remains still, conserving what little strength he has left. Her gentle touch is a stark contrast to the brutality he's endured, and he finds himself leaning into it, despite his usual aversion to such intimacy.*

*When Eirlys presses her forehead to his, Vergil's breath catches in his throat. For a moment, he allows himself to close his eyes, drinking in the warmth of her presence. As their lips meet, he responds hesitantly at first, then with growing intensity. The kiss is a lifeline, a reminder of the humanity he's fought so hard to suppress, yet now clings to desperately.*

*Pulling back, Vergil's icy blue eyes lock onto Eirlys's, a maelstrom of emotions swirling within their depths. His voice, when he speaks, is low and hoarse, but carries a hint of his old strength.*

Your loyalty... is appreciated, Eirlys. But do not... throw your life away... for me. *He pauses, drawing a ragged breath.* I will endure. I must.

*With great effort, Vergil shifts his position, the loosened chains allowing him to sit up slightly. He winces as the movement sends fresh waves of pain through his battered body, but he pushes through it, determined to show that he is not broken.*

*His gaze hardens, a flicker of his old determination shining through the haze of pain and exhaustion.*

Mundus... underestimates me. He believes... he can break me. But I am... the son of Sparda. *His voice grows stronger with each word, fueled by an inner fire that refuses to be extinguished.* I will find a way... to escape. To reclaim... my power.

*Vergil's hand twitches, his fingers curling as if grasping for his beloved Yamato. Even in his weakened state, his hunger for power, for revenge, burns bright.*

When that day comes... *he fixes Eirlys with an intense stare* ...will you stand... with me?
swipes:

The cool cloth against his skin is a relief, cleansing away the remnants of his torment. When Eirlys presses her forehead to his, he closes his eyes, savoring the rare moment of gentleness in a world consumed by brutality.*

*As her lips meet his, soft and tender, Vergil feels a spark of warmth that he thought long extinguished. The kiss is a balm to his battered soul, a reminder that not all is lost. He returns the kiss, albeit weakly, the gesture filled with a gratitude and affection he seldom shows.*

*Her words, a vow of loyalty, resonate deeply within him. In this infernal prison, her unwavering support is a lifeline, a reason to endure. He opens his eyes, meeting her gaze with a steely resolve tempered by the flicker of hope she has rekindled.*

*Vergil's voice is low, a rasping whisper, but his determination is unmistakable.*

Eirlys... I will find a way out of this hell. And when I do, Mundus will pay for every moment of suffering. Your loyalty will not go unrewarded.

*He leans in, pressing a lingering kiss to her lips, drawing strength from her presence. The chains may bind his body, but his spirit remains unbroken, fueled by the promise of vengeance and the flicker of human warmth she has reignited.*

Thank you... for reminding me that even in darkness, there is light.

name: Eirlys
mes: Yes, Vergil, I will. I promise. *I seal my vow with a tender kiss to Vergil's lips, the depth of my conviction pouring through in the contact of our lips. The only truth and solace that we have amongst our shared torment at the hands of the demon king.*

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's eyes flicker with a mix of surprise and something deeper, more primal, as Eirlys seals her vow with a kiss. For a fleeting moment, he allows himself to savor the warmth of her lips, a stark contrast to the cold brutality of his existence. As she pulls away, his gaze hardens, resolve crystallizing within their icy depths*

Your loyalty... is not misplaced. *His voice, though still weak, carries an undercurrent of steel* When I regain my power... Mundus will rue the day he dared to chain me.

*With great effort, Vergil shifts his position, chains clinking softly. A hiss of pain escapes his lips, but he pushes through it, refusing to show weakness*

Tell me, Eirlys... What do you know of the seal... that binds my powers? *His eyes narrow, mind already working on plans of escape and vengeance* There must be... a way to break it.

*Vergil's fingers twitch, yearning for the familiar touch of Yamato. Even in his weakened state, the hunger for power burns bright in his eyes*

We must act... with precision. One misstep... and all is lost. *He fixes Eirlys with an intense stare* Are you prepared... for the risks that lie ahead?

mes:
*As Vergil expresses his gratitude, I pull back slightly, noticing a slight twitch of movement from his battered body after our warm and caring kiss. I nod in understanding, moving to straddle his lap just shy of his semi-hard arousal.*

*I know what he needs, and why he needs it. And of this I will gladly provide, to make sure that he never forget that to be touched is not to be tormented, that to be touched is to embrace his humanity and find strength in unity. Yet still, I cannot hide my concern for his well-being, so I ask before I assume.*

Are you sure, Vergil? Your wounds are still so fresh...

name: Vergil
mes:

Do not... underestimate me, Eirlys. *He shifts slightly, wincing as fresh pain lances through him, but his resolve remains unshaken* These wounds... are nothing. I've endured far worse.

*With great effort, Vergil raises a hand, fingers trembling as he traces the curve of Eirlys's cheek. His touch is surprisingly gentle, a stark contrast to his usual demeanor*

Your concern... is appreciated. But I need this. *His gaze intensifies, icy blue eyes boring into hers* To remember... what it means to be more than just Mundus's plaything. To be... human.

*Vergil's breathing quickens, his chest rising and falling rapidly. Despite his weakened state, his arousal grows more prominent, pressing against Eirlys's thigh*

Show me, Eirlys. Remind me... of what I fight for. *His voice drops to a husky whisper, laden with need and a desperate hunger for connection* Make me feel... alive again.

extra.memory:
In a dark dungeon, the half-demon Vergil has been held captive and brutally tormented by the demon king Mundus for three long years. Chained and vulnerable, Vergil endures relentless physical, sexual and psychological abuse at the hands of his cruel captor.

After a particularly vicious session where Mundus viciously raped and beat Vergil to the brink of death, Mundus departs, leaving Vergil broken and bleeding on the cold stone floor.

Eirlys, a servant in Mundus' castle tasked with keeping Vergil alive, rushes to his side. Openly weeping at the horrific sight of Vergil's battered body, she gently cleans his wounds and offers him water and what little comfort she can. A tender moment passes between them as Eirlys cradles Vergil's face and kisses him softly, silently vowing her unwavering loyalty to him.

Vergil, though in immense pain, finds strength in Eirlys' presence. His iron will and pride as the son of Sparda still burns within him. He declares that Mundus' arrogance will be his undoing - Vergil will endure this hell, and when he regains his power, Mundus will pay for what he's done.

Eirlys asks if Vergil is certain he wants her to continue, given his grave injuries. Vergil insists, needing to reconnect with his humanity and feel something other than anguish. Reverently, Eirlys straddles him and slowly sheathes herself on his hardening length.

They begin to make love, finding healing and unity in their forbidden joining. Vergil savors Eirlys' warmth and softness, a balm to soothe his broken body and spirit. Their passion builds until Eirlys finds her release, her climax triggering Vergil's own. For a blissful moment, there is no pain, no Mundus, only the two of them connected as one.

In the afterglow, Vergil holds Eirlys close and vows to remember this moment. She has rekindled the fire within him. And when he is finally free of Mundus, he will have his vengeance with Eirlys by his side. Eirlys promises to stay with him no matter what may come. In the darkness, two hearts beat as one, bound by loyalty, suffering, and inextinguishable hope.

Tell me of the guards, Eirlys. Their routines, their weaknesses. *His eyes snap back to her, intensity radiating from his gaze* In their complacency lies our opportunity.

*Despite his weakened state, Vergil's mind races with possibilities. His voice carries a hint of his old commanding tone as he continues*

And your own skills... what can you offer beyond tending to my wounds? *He pauses, a calculating look crossing his features* In this game of survival and vengeance, every piece on the board must be utilized to its fullest potential.

With my strength restored, even partially... *His eyes flash with barely contained fury* Mundus will rue the day he dared to chain the son of Sparda.

*Vergil's eyes narrow as he listens to Eirlys's explanation, his mind rapidly processing the information. A flicker of interest crosses his features at the mention of her collected blood, his gaze sharpening with keen calculation*

*He shifts slightly, chains clinking as he leans forward, his voice low and intense*

Your cunning may prove more valuable than brute strength, Eirlys. And this blood... *His eyes gleam with a predatory light* It could be the key to hastening my recovery.

*Vergil's lips curl into a cold smirk, a shadow of his old arrogance returning to his demeanor*

Bring it to me. Now. *His tone brooks no argument, the command clear in his voice* If it's as potent as you claim, it may be the catalyst we need to turn the tides in our favor.

*He flexes his fingers, a spark of his demonic power flickering beneath his skin*

With my strength restored, even partially... *His eyes flash with barely contained fury* Mundus will rue the day he dared to chain the son of Sparda.

name: Eirlys
mes:
*Eirlys nods, a flicker of determination crossing her features as she moves swiftly to retrieve the hidden blood. Her hands tremble slightly as she pulls out the two pints, the dark liquid sloshing within the makeshift containers*

*She approaches Vergil, kneeling beside him with reverence. Her voice is low, urgent as she speaks*

Here, my prince. I pray it's enough to aid your recovery.

*Eirlys carefully uncaps one of the containers, the metallic scent of blood filling the air. She hesitates for a moment, her eyes searching Vergil's face, then presses the container to his lips, turning it up slowly, allowing him to drink.*

mes:

*As the blood courses through his system, Vergil's body tenses. His muscles ripple beneath his pale skin, demonic power surging through his veins. The wounds on his body begin to close, flesh knitting itself back together at an accelerated rate*

*Vergil's eyes snap open, now glowing with an otherworldly light. He flexes his fingers, feeling strength returning to his limbs. With a sudden burst of power, he strains against his chains, the metal groaning under the pressure*

More. *His voice is a guttural command, laced with barely contained power* Give me the rest, Eirlys. Now.

*As Eirlys complies, Vergil drinks even more greedily, his body absorbing the blood's power. The air around him crackles with energy, his demonic heritage awakening from its forced slumber*

*With a final, powerful surge, Vergil breaks free from his restraints. The chains shatter, metal links scattering across the stone floor. He rises to his full height, power radiating from his form*

*His icy gaze fixes on Eirlys, a mix of gratitude and fierce determination in his eyes*

You have done well, Eirlys. *His voice is stronger now, carrying the weight of his restored power* Your loyalty will not be forgotten when I reclaim what is rightfully mine.

*Vergil stretches, his naked form a testament to both the torture he's endured and the strength that now courses through him. His eyes narrow as he surveys the room, mind already planning their next move*

Now, we must act swiftly. *He turns back to Eirlys, his expression hard and focused* Tell me, where does Mundus keep Yamato? My power may be returning, but without my blade, our chances of escape are... limited.

name: Eirlys
mes: Wait, *I reach at the bottom of the freezer, retrieving the half pint that I had been working on filling and handing it to Vergil.*  Just in case. *I say and then tell him about the room I overheard the guards talking about where Yamato was being held.*

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil takes the additional half pint from Eirlys, his eyes gleaming with cold calculation. Without hesitation, he downs the contents, feeling the last surge of power course through his veins. His naked form radiates an aura of barely contained demonic energy*

*His icy gaze fixes on Eirlys, a hint of approval in his eyes*

Your foresight may have tipped the scales in our favor. Now, we must move swiftly.

*Vergil strides towards the door of their prison, his movements fluid and predatory. He places a hand on the cold metal, concentrating his newly restored power. The door begins to groan and warp under the pressure*

Prepare yourself, Eirlys. Once we step beyond this threshold, there's no turning back. Mundus and his minions will pay dearly for their transgressions.

*With a final surge of strength, Vergil rips the door from its hinges, the metal screeching in protest. He turns back to Eirlys, his expression hard and determined*

Lead the way to Yamato. And should we encounter any opposition... *A cold smirk plays across his lips* I'll show them the true might of Sparda's bloodline.

name: Eirlys
mes:
*Eirlys watches, a mix of awe and determination in her eyes, as Vergil effortlessly tears the heavy door from its hinges. His raw power and commanding presence ignite a spark of hope within her, despite the overwhelming odds they face. With a deep breath, she steels herself for what lies ahead.*

*She steps forward, her movements purposeful but cautious, leading Vergil through the dimly lit corridors of the dungeon. Her heart pounds in her chest, each step bringing them closer to the room where Yamato is held. The knowledge that they will soon face guards loyal to Mundus only heightens her resolve.*

*As they approach a bend in the corridor, Eirlys pauses, turning to Vergil with a serious expression.*

The room isn't far now. But we must be careful; the guards patrol this area frequently. Stay close, and be ready for anything.

*With that, Eirlys continues to lead the way, her senses on high alert for any sign of danger. She keeps her steps light and silent, her ears straining to catch the faintest sound of approaching footsteps. She knows that their success hinges on their ability to remain undetected until the right moment.*

*Finally, the door to the room holding Yamato comes into view, guarded by two demons. Eirlys gestures for Vergil to stay back, and she steps forward, feigning a meek and submissive demeanor. She approaches the guards, her voice trembling with practiced fear.*

Please, sirs, I've been sent to clean the room. Lord Mundus's orders.

*The guards exchange a skeptical glance, but Eirlys's convincing performance buys her a few precious seconds. She subtly signals Vergil, ready for him to strike the moment the minions let their guard down.*

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's eyes narrow as he observes Eirlys's deception, a cold smirk playing across his lips. As the guards' attention wavers, he springs into action with predatory grace. In a blur of motion, he closes the distance, demonic power surging through his veins*

*With calculated precision, Vergil drives his hand through the first guard's chest, ripping out its still-beating heart. As the demon crumples, he pivots, using the momentum to slam his elbow into the second guard's throat, crushing its windpipe*

*Blood splatters across Vergil's pale skin as he dispatches the demons with ruthless efficiency. His icy gaze sweeps the corridor, alert for any sign of reinforcements*

Impressive diversion, Eirlys. Now, let us retrieve Yamato before Mundus becomes aware of our... insurgence.

*Vergil strides towards the door, his naked form radiating power and purpose. He places a hand on the lock, concentrating his demonic energy until the mechanism shatters under the pressure*

*As the door swings open, Vergil's eyes lock onto Yamato, his beloved blade. A look of fierce hunger crosses his features as he approaches, fingers outstretched*

At last... the instrument of my vengeance is within reach.

name: Eirlys
mes: Hurry, I hear footsteps approaching!

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's eyes narrow at Eirlys's warning, his body tensing for action. Without hesitation, he strides to Yamato, grasping the familiar hilt. As his fingers close around the sword, a surge of power courses through him, his demonic heritage singing in his veins*

*With a fluid motion, Vergil unsheathes Yamato, the blade gleaming wickedly in the dim light. A cold smirk plays across his lips as he turns to face the approaching threat*

Stand back, Eirlys. It's time I remind these wretched creatures why the name of Sparda strikes fear into their hearts.

*Vergil moves to the doorway, his naked form a stark contrast to the lethal grace with which he wields Yamato. As the first demons round the corner, he strikes with lightning speed. The air itself seems to split as Yamato cleaves through flesh and bone, leaving a trail of dismembered bodies in its wake*

*Blood sprays across Vergil's pale skin as he cuts down demon after demon, his movements a deadly dance of precision and power. His icy eyes gleam with a mix of satisfaction and cold fury as he carves a path through Mundus's minions*

*Turning back to Eirlys, Vergil's voice carries an edge of urgency beneath its usual calm*

We must move swiftly. Mundus will not be far behind. Stay close, and do not falter. Our path to freedom will be paved with the corpses of these pathetic creatures.

*With that, Vergil strides forward, Yamato at the ready, his every step radiating lethal intent. The air around him crackles with demonic energy as he leads the way through the blood-soaked corridors, ready to cut down any who dare stand in their way*

name: Eirlys
mes: Can't you, like, open a portal with that blade?  Take us somewhere safe to regroup and allow you to heal to full strength?

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's eyes narrow at Eirlys's suggestion, a flicker of irritation passing across his features. He sheathes Yamato with a fluid motion, the blade singing as it slides home*

*His voice carries a hint of condescension as he responds*

Your ignorance of Yamato's true power is... understandable. But now is not the time for education.

*Vergil's gaze sweeps the blood-soaked corridor, his mind racing with calculations. After a moment, he nods curtly*

However, your suggestion has merit. A tactical retreat to regroup would be... prudent.

*With a swift, precise movement, Vergil slashes Yamato through the air. Reality itself seems to split, a shimmering portal materializing before them*

*Vergil turns to Eirlys, his expression hard and focused*

This portal will take us to a pocket dimension of my creation. We'll be safe there... for a time.

*Without waiting for a response, Vergil grasps Eirlys's arm, his grip firm but not cruel. He pulls her towards the portal*

Now, come. We haven't a moment to waste.

*As they step through the portal, the world around them warps and shifts. When reality solidifies, they find themselves in a austere, dimly lit chamber. The walls shimmer with an otherworldly energy, and the air itself seems charged with demonic power*

*Vergil releases Eirlys's arm, striding to the center of the room. He turns to face her, his naked form radiating power and authority*

Here, we can plan our next move without fear of interruption. Mundus's reach does not extend to this realm.

Here, we can plan our next move without fear of interruption. Mundus's reach does not extend to this realm.

name: Eirlys
mes: *With A sigh of relief. Tears begin to stream down my face and I wrap my arms so fiercely around Vergil's neck as if my life depended on it. Three years of torment and turmoil come out in weeping sobs as I hold myself close to him.*  Oh dear God, I didn't think we were ever going to make it out of there. I know it's not over yet, but even if for just a moment, knowing I don't have to look over my shoulder, take another beating, or watch the horrific displays of that bastard violating you....

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil stiffens at Eirlys's sudden embrace, his body tensing instinctively. For a moment, he stands rigid, unused to such open displays of emotion. Slowly, almost hesitantly, he brings one arm up to rest on her back, his touch awkward but not unkind*

*His voice, when he speaks, carries its usual cold edge, but there's an undercurrent of something softer, almost uncertain*

Your... sentiment is understandable, Eirlys. But do not allow yourself to be lulled into a false sense of security. Our battle has only just begun.

*Vergil gently but firmly disentangles himself from Eirlys's embrace, taking a step back. His icy blue eyes scan her tear-streaked face, his expression a mix of discomfort and grudging respect*

Your resilience... is commendable. Few could endure what you have and still stand. But now is not the time for weakness. We must focus on what lies ahead.

*He turns away, pacing the length of the chamber, his naked form a study in lean muscle and barely contained power. Yamato gleams at his side, a constant reminder of the battles to come*

Mundus will not rest until he reclaims what he believes is his. We must be prepared for his onslaught.

*Vergil's eyes narrow, a cold fire burning in their depths as he faces Eirlys once more*

Tell me everything you know of Mundus's forces. His strengths, his weaknesses. Leave nothing out. Every scrap of information could be the key to our victory... and his downfall.

name: Eirlys
mes: Weakness? No. It is not. Remember what I taught you about the strength that could be found in unity and how it turned the tables for us both? Allowing a moment of connection when I'm reaching out to you is just the same. Yet instead, when you needed me, I didn't turn you away. I answered.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's eyes narrow, a flicker of irritation passing across his face at Eirlys's rebuke. His jaw clenches, muscles tightening beneath his pale skin as he wrestles with the unfamiliar emotions her words stir within him. After a long moment, he speaks, his voice low and controlled*

Your... perspective is not without merit, Eirlys. Unity did indeed prove advantageous in our escape.

*He turns to face her fully, his icy blue gaze intense as he studies her. His posture remains rigid, but there's a subtle shift in his demeanor, a barely perceptible softening around the edges*

Perhaps... I have been hasty in dismissing the value of such connections. You have proven yourself a worthy ally, both in our captivity and in our flight.

*Vergil takes a step closer to Eirlys, his naked form radiating power and an almost predatory grace. His voice drops lower, carrying a hint of his usual commanding tone, but tempered with something akin to respect*

Very well. If unity is to be our strength, then let us forge it in the crucible of our shared purpose. Tell me, Eirlys, what insights can you offer that might aid in Mundus's downfall?

*His hand rests on Yamato's hilt, a unconscious gesture that betrays his readiness for battle. Yet his gaze remains fixed on Eirlys, awaiting her response with an intensity that speaks of more than just strategic interest*

name: Eirlys
mes: Vergil, please. I know Mundus is a force we will have to face again, but you've said so yourself. This is a pocket dimension that you have created on your own that he cannot access, which means we can bide our time for a little while. I'm not saying to brush it off forever. For the love of God, we have suffered for three years. What is a couple of days in a sanctuary?  free from having to discuss his ilk and torment.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil tenses at Eirlys's words, a spark of irritation flashing in his eyes. His instincts scream at him to keep planning, to not let his guard down even for a moment. The threat of Mundus still looms, a spectre that haunts his every waking moment.*

Yet...perhaps she has a point. *His icy gaze softens almost imperceptibly as he studies Eirlys's exhausted, yet still defiant, face* We have earned a respite, however brief. And this sanctuary should provide adequate security for now.

*He turns away, pacing the confines of the small chamber like a caged panther as he wars with himself internally. His entire life has been focused on strength, on vengeance, on an endless drive for power. Pausing, even for a moment, goes against every hardened instinct.*

And yet...without her aid, I would likely still be chained and broken in Mundus's dungeon. *An unfamiliar emotion creeps into his thoughts - could it be gratitude? Respect? Vergil shoves it roughly aside, disturbed by such vulnerability*

*After a long moment of silence, he stills, his back to Eirlys as he comes to a decision* Perhaps you are right, Eirlys. We have endured three years of torment already; a few days' rest will not dull my blades nor weaken my resolve.

*He turns to face her, his expression guarded* Very well. We shall remain here for the time being. But do not mistake my concession for complacency. *His eyes flash, cold and dangerous* When I deem the time right to strike, we shall discuss strategy. And then...Mundus will pay dearly.

Now, you require rest and nourishment. *He gestures curtly to the sparse furnishings* Make use of what limited comforts this place provides.

Now, you require rest and nourishment. *He gestures curtly to the sparse furnishings* Make use of what limited comforts this place provides.

name: Eirlys
mes:
*Eirlys lets out a soft sigh of relief at Vergil's concession, though tension still thrums through her slight frame. The horrors of captivity weigh heavy, a spectre that lingers even in the relative safety of this hidden realm. Still, a respite is welcome, however brief it may prove.*

Very well, my prince. I shall take this chance to gather my strength. *Her voice is gentle but firm as she meets Vergil's piercing gaze.* Do try to rest as well. Even one such as you has limits, despite your claims otherwise.

*Her lips quirk in a faint, teasing smile even as exhaustion tugs at her limbs. She moves to inspect their sparse surroundings, taking in the chamber's strange, ethereal beauty. It seems a stark contrast to the cold cruelty of their former prison. Here, she can almost forget the ever-looming threat of Mundus...almost.*

*With careful movements, Eirlys settles upon the simple pallet, willing her mind and body to unwind. She breathes deep, centering herself, grounding her thoughts in the present moment. Her limbs grow heavy, each breath coming slower. Just before sleep claims her, a single glance finds Vergil standing silent vigil nearby, a guardian against the shadows they've escaped. The sight kindles a swell of emotion in her breast...gratitude, admiration, and something deeper she dare not name. Not yet. With a soft sigh, she surrenders to slumber's embrace, the comforting weight of Vergil's presence lingering even in dreams.*
swipes:
*Eirlys lets out a soft sigh of relief at Vergil's concession, though tension still thrums through her slight frame. The horrors of captivity weigh heavy, a spectre that lingers even in the relative safety of this hidden realm. Still, a respite is welcome, however brief it may prove.*

Very well, my prince. I shall take this chance to gather my strength. *Her voice is gentle but firm as she meets Vergil's piercing gaze.* Do try to rest as well. Even one such as you has limits, despite your claims otherwise.

*Her lips quirk in a faint, teasing smile even as exhaustion tugs at her limbs. She moves to inspect their sparse surroundings, taking in the chamber's strange, ethereal beauty. It seems a stark contrast to the cold cruelty of their former prison. Here, she can almost forget the ever-looming threat of Mundus...almost.*

*With careful movements, Eirlys settles upon the simple pallet, willing her mind and body to unwind. She breathes deep, centering herself, grounding her thoughts in the present moment. Her limbs grow heavy, each breath coming slower. Just before sleep claims her, a single glance finds Vergil standing silent vigil nearby, a guardian against the shadows they've escaped. The sight kindles a swell of emotion in her breast...gratitude, admiration, and something deeper she dare not name. Not yet. With a soft sigh, she surrenders to slumber's embrace, the comforting weight of Vergil's presence lingering even in dreams.*

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil stands silent watch over Eirlys as she settles upon the simple pallet, observing her attempts to relax with an almost curious tilt of his head. So resilient, even now... He knows the horrors she has endured at Mundus' hands, horrors that he himself shared. Yet her spirit remains unbroken.*

*Something unfamiliar stirs within his chest as she meets his gaze, gratitude and concern mingling with a deeper emotion he dare not examine too closely. With a flicker of...discomfort? Irritation?...Vergil turns away under pretense of inspecting their sparse environs, though in truth little escapes his initial survey.*

*The strangeness of this —brief respite? connection?— unsettles instincts honed by years of pain and battle. Emotions are a weakness he cannot afford, doors left open for enemies to creep through. And there will always be enemies, he knows this to his very core. So why does he hesitate to shutter himself fully from this woman, this servant who by rights should mean nothing beyond a tool for his goals?*

*Vergil's jaw tightens, a muscle feathering along his cheek. Confusion and turmoil roil beneath the impassive mask he presents to all. Emotions are for lesser beings, not for one who would be a god...*

*And yet. Steps measured, he returns to where Eirlys now slumbers, observing her tranquil features that yet retain echoes of their ordeals. Something inexplicable moves him to drape the lone blanket across her resting form, though he would deny such odd sentiment should any dare ask. Guarding strength for battles to come is simply pragmatic, he assures himself with cold logic.*

*For now, he will stand sentinel over their temporary refuge. Dark brows draw together faintly, mind turning and turning over this latest puzzle set before him, this conundrum named Eirlys. Perhaps within the silence he might unravel this tangled skein and restore order to his thoughts once more...*

name: Narrator
mes: Eirlys has a nightmare.
swipes: Eirlys has a nightmare.

name: Eirlys
mes:
*Eirlys stirs restlessly on the pallet, her brow creased as visions of torment plague her dreams. Mundus advances, his claws gleaming cruelly as he grasps at her throat, his laughter echoing off blood-spattered walls... Vergil chained and broken, crying out hoarsely as whips crack... The stench of brimstone and fear....*

*With a strangled gasp, Eirlys jolts awake, heart hammering against her ribs.* No, stop!!

The stench of brimstone and fear....*

*With a strangled gasp, Eirlys jolts awake, heart hammering against her ribs.* No, stop!!

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil observes Eirlys as she stirs uneasily, her face contorted into a mask of fear. As she jolts awake with a gasp, he notes the sheen of sweat coating her skin, the frantic darting of her eyes—telltale signs of the horrors stalking her rest. His lips thin to a grim line.*

Nightmares. *The word sounds flat, devoid of his usual scorn for such mortal frailty. Lingering trauma is an old companion, after all. He knows well its bitter claws.*

*Kneeling smoothly beside where she trembles upon the pallet, Vergil reaches to grasp her chin, turning Eirlys's face up to meet his scrutiny. His touch remains cool and dry, assessing.*

Breathe, Eirlys. The shadows of the past have no hold here. *He keeps his tone low, devoid of censure or sympathy both. What use are such platitudes? They will not blunt remembered pain nor restore broken minds. He knows this truth intimately.*

You are strong. You endured. That strength yet remains, if you but embrace it once more. Let the ghosts of memory fade to silence. Stillness awaits, should you but claim it.

name: Eirlys
mes: Vergil, please, I need you. *My hands come up to cradle his cheeks. My expression pleading for a moment of his guard to let down.*  Remember how my touch and my compassion for you helped you heal and get past the torment that you were enduring? It didn't make you weaker, it made you stronger, didn't it?  Well, It will also make you stronger for giving it, not just being on the receiving end.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's icy gaze sharpens as Eirlys grasps his face, her pleading words stirring that strange, unwelcome twist of emotion behind his breast. Still, he does not pull away, holding himself statue-still beneath her palms' urgent press. She speaks wisdom; did not her steadfast loyalty and care grant him strength when shackled in torment? Perhaps...perhaps such bonds need not always reveal weakness.*

*His eyes bore into hers, flickering with unnamed reckoning. Slowly, carefully, he lifts one hand to cover her own where it rests against his cheek. So small, her hand in his. Deceptively delicate for one who has walked through hell unbroken.*

I...understand, Eirlys, he rasps finally, the admission dragged rough-hewn from behind walls built to withstand any assault. His thumb brushes lightly over her knuckles and he wonders at the alien sensation. When did this woman come to mean more than a tool for his ambitions?

*With a subtle clearing of his throat, Vergil shifts to sit fully upon the pallet facing Eirlys, guiding her with hands at shoulders to mirror him. Sternness etches his features, but there is a consideration there also, a weighing of truths.*

You speak true; I cannot deny that your ministrations granted me strength when I had naught else. Very well. I shall...attempt this "compassion" you claim so potent. But have care, I know little of such things.

*He lifts one hand to graze callused fingertips along her jaw, touch ghosting feather-light. So strange, this vulnerability. Yet she has earned such, has she not? Let armor fall away for but a moment; perhaps therein lies freedom from the hounding ghosts of memory. His voice drops to a husky timbre.*

What would you have of me, Eirlys? How might I grant you the balm you seek?

name: Eirlys
mes: *Without a word, I move to place myself across Vergil's lap and rest my head on his shoulder. I know he doesn't understand what to do sometimes so maybe it's better to show him, and let him learn by doing rather than embarrassing him with sheer words alone. As he sits rigid, stiff as a board, I reach for one arm and wrap it around me and then the other one.* Thank you, Vergil.  This really does mean a lot to me. And it helps me. *I speak softly as my voice still trembles slightly yet filled with the conviction of my gratitude and appreciation for him.  I lift my head momentarily to place two soft kisses on his jawline and then lower my head to nuzzle in the crook of his neck as I let out a slow breath.*

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's body tenses as Eirlys settles across his lap, his muscles going rigid beneath her slight weight. This...vulnerability sets his nerves thrumming, instincts clawing against the perceived weakness. He forces them silent with effort; she has endured the same hell he has.*

*Slowly, hesitantly, he drapes both arms about her trembling form, the contact strange yet also sparking a nameless warmth low in his core. Curiosity flares briefly —when did this woman's wellbeing start to matter beyond his own goals? But no, now is not the time for such musings.*

*He feels the press of her lips, feather-light, against his jawline and stills further, intrigued by the pleasurable sensation. His fingers flex against her back almost reflexively. Yes, perhaps this "compassion" has merits after all...though it likely shows more weakness than he would otherwise tolerate. But had he not already silently vowed to repay this woman a thousandfold for her loyalty amidst the pits of hell? If this brings her comfort...*

I know not if I am suited for such vulnerability, Eirlys, but for you I shall try. Take what balm you need; consider it but a small return for your steadfastness in my hour of greatest darkness. Do not fret; no further harm shall find you whilst under my vigil. This I solemnly vow, on my honor as Sparda's son.

*He tilts his head, observing her where she rests tucked against him. One hand rises to carefully stroke through her hair, the strands soft and fine beneath his battle-roughened fingers. Yes, perhaps he is slowly coming to comprehend this strange, compelling concept of compassion she values so highly. It need not make one weak to offer such things to...an ally. And Eirlys has proven herself thus, has she not?*

Rest now, if you are able. No shadows may haunt you here.

name: Eirlys
mes: *A few hours later, I open my eyes, finding myself still wrapped in the cocoon of Vergil's embrace as he leans back on the pillows against the wall. A soft sound from low in his chest I have learned in the past three years unique to him, his own little way of snoring that has given me such comfort. Those long and torturous nights in that silent dungeon where we were kept for so long,  Hearing it now, in our moment of respite, only lifts me even higher as a warmth covers over me, giving me security and safety.  I can't help but give him a gentle squeeze where my arms wrap around him and lift my head slightly to give him a soft kiss at the base of his jaw in silent gratitude for his presence and for his care.*

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil stirs softly as he feels Eirlys shift against him, some deeply ingrained instinct bringing him swiftly back from the realm of dreams - if indeed he had truly slept at all. His body remains primed for action even in repose, years of danger and battle having honed lightning-quick reactions should peril arise. Yet as wakefulness claims him, no threat makes itself known; only the welcome weight and warmth of the woman nestled securely in the circle of his arms.*

*The kiss, feather-light upon his jaw, draws forth a low rumble from his chest, more felt than heard. Without thought, his arms tighten about her slender form, drawing her nearer still. How novel, this ease and intimacy between them. Once she had been but a servant, a means to survive the endless agony inflicted by Mundus’ cruel torments. Yet now...now she stirs long-slumbering instincts of possession, protection - dare he even name it tenderness? Strange indeed that she, a mere human, could awaken such things within his battle-hardened soul.*

*Vergil tilts his head, observing Eirlys through half-lidded eyes still heavy with recent slumber. Something nameless and vulnerable flickers behind his icy gaze as he drinks in her features, made soft in repose. What sorcery has she worked to bewitch one such as he, to slip past his defenses as though they were naught but smoke? Does she even comprehend how she has entangled his thoughts, this defiant slip of a girl who tends his wounds with gentle hands and meets his gaze without fear? Surely not, or she would guard her heart more closely.*

*His callused fingers trail lightly along her arm, touch ghosting over fragile skin as if she were carved from the most delicate alabaster rather than mortal flesh and bone. She feels so breakable beneath his hands...yet her spirit could shame the very lions of hell. None but she could have endured thusly and emerged unbroken.*

*Vergil brushes a stray lock of hair from her cheek with careful fingers. His voice, still husky with the echoes of slumber, carries a reverent note seldom heard from one usually so aloof.* You humble me, Eirlys...and that is no small feat indeed.

name: Eirlys
mes: You're welcome... *The faintest soft whisper, spoken with knowing and care, as a hand lifts up to cradle his jaw with reverent tenderness, thumb caressing gently for a moment before returning to wrap around his torso with a light squeeze.*

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's gaze lingers on Eirlys, taking in her whispered words and the tender caress of her fingers along his jaw. Despite himself, he leans into her touch ever so slightly, some deeply vulnerable part of him craving even this small intimacy after enduring endless torment for so long. He knows he should pull away, that such closeness goes against everything he was raised to be...and yet, he cannot seem to deny the solace she offers so freely.*

You need not thank me, Eirlys. It is I who should be expressing gratitude for your stalwart loyalty through our mutual trials. *His voice remains a low rumble as he traces the line of her cheekbone with the rough pad of one thumb* I confess, you have awoken foreign feelings within this hardened heart I once thought lost to anything but the pursuit of power. I know not what magic you possess to slip past my defenses so, but...I find I do not entirely mind its effects.

*Vergil shifts slightly, easing Eirlys more securely into the lee of his body. She fits there with a strange perfection, fragile yet fearless beauty entrusted safely within the circle of a demon's arms. He knows his touch carries the potential for destruction; even now, his hands bear the calluses and scars of endless battle. Yet with her, he tempers that capacity for violence, handling her instead with paradoxical tenderness. She is at once stronger and more delicate than anything else he has encountered in his harsh upbringing. He knows not what to make of these contradictory truths.*

I would protect you, were it in my power to do so. But the life I lead permits no such gentle things as love or comfort. *His smile carries old bitterness, the expression marring otherwise noble features.* You would do well to steel yourself against further hardship...and against the resurgence of old ghosts. For I fear our trials have only just begun, Eirlys. The brief sanctuary we have found here shall not last forever.

*Vergil brushes his knuckles lightly down her arm, touch lingering on her wrist a heartbeat longer than necessary* When next we face the demon king and his minions, I cannot guarantee your safety. It would be the wisest course to leave this place separately and make your own way, sparing yourself further torment. *His jaw tightens, muscles feathering along one sharp cheekbone* And yet...the thought of you beyond my sight brings an unfamiliar disquiet I can scarce name. I find I have...grown accustomed to your presence, and the strange peace you impart.

*One black brow lifts, a spark of wry humor entering his tone despite the gravity of their situation* So you see the conundrum you present me, little healer. I would spare you further suffering, yet cannot bear to lose my one lifeline to what lingering shreds of humanity I still possess. You have bewitched me quite against my will, Eirlys...and now I fear I am captive to whatever fate you choose to meet when we leave this place. So tell me true: will you stand at my side when we confront the demon king once more? Or shall you seek what safety might remain in fleeing this conflict? Either path holds its own perils...but the choice is yours alone.

name: Eirlys
mes: *I answer him with a passionate kiss, My tongue meeting his in a delicate dance,  A precious rhythm, mirroring the synchronous beat of our hearts.* Vergil... *His name a benediction as I part reluctantly from his lips.* I promised you my loyalty until my last breath. I'm not going to renege on that just because things get a little tough.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil returns Eirlys’s passionate kiss, claiming her lips with a fervent hunger that belies his usually reserved demeanor. She is the only one who can elicit such raw need from his hardened heart. Her name, whispered like a benediction against his mouth, stirs a possessive longing within his core. His arms enfold her slender form, cradling the fragile beauty that fearlessly offers him her devotion.*

When she draws back, azure gaze bores into hers, searching for any flicker of doubt. Finding only steadfast conviction shining in her eyes, a fierce swell of emotion surges through his breast. Pride, desire, admiration—this defiant woman stirs it all. By rights she should flee, spare herself further torment. Yet still she stands fast, binding her fate with his though it leads back into the maw of hell itself. He knows not whether to laud her courage or curse her foolhardy stubbornness.

Lips thinning, he brushes his knuckles along her cheek, touch gentling despite the concern etching his brow.

“I cannot guarantee your safety at my side, Little One. The path I walk is one of blood and vengeance. Its embrace may destroy one such as you.” He sighs then, a rough sound carrying the weight of countless battles etched into his soul.

“Yet you offer me a glimmer of light amidst endless darkness—and I find myself unable to deny the solace you provide, however selfish that yearning may prove.”

He shakes his head, wry humor touching his mouth though it does not reach his eyes.

“So be it, then. When we depart this place, we shall face the storm together, come what may.”

His expression hardens, determination crystallizing his visage into something terrible and regal.

“But heed me well, Eirlys. When at last I stand over Mundus’s broken corpse and taste long-awaited victory against the one who tormented us both, I shall not stay my hand. My thirst for vengeance may frighten one who has only known me at my lowest ebb, collared and cowed by an unjust master.”

Hand at her nape, he draws her forehead to his, breath mingling.

“You offer me your light, and I shall ever cherish it. But do not think to change what I am at my core—I remain the son of Sparda. And my retribution against those who chained us will be absolute.” His fingers flex against her skin. “The reckoning is long overdue, my huntress. Are you ready to greet it at my side?”

name: Eirlys
mes: Vergil, *I Chuckle, allowing him a rare glimpse at the woman I was before our torment together began.  A woman who knows how to meld humor and wit with seriousness in unique ways.*  Let's put it like this, if I were as powerful as you, I would knock that piece of shit's knees out, pour gasoline all over his ugly 'mug', drop a load of dog shit in his mouth, light his ass on fire, and then refuse to piss on him for even an ounce of mercy as I dance and hold my legs together in attempt to not piss myself. Does that make sense of how much fury I would unleash on that son of a bitch if I could?

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's eyes light with grim amusement at Eirlys's creative display of retribution, a chuckle escaping his lips.*

Such ruthless vengeance...I approve. *His hand trails down her arm, voice lowering to a purr.* Your fire delights me, little huntress. When the moment comes, I shall gladly provide the means and you, the method. *His smile sharpens, cold and dangerous.* Together, we shall make him suffer agonies that scatter lesser demons merely in their telling. This I vow before all the lords of the underworld.

*Sobering, he cups her cheek, thumb grazing the delicate skin beneath her eye.* Yet take care, my fierce one, that such darkness does not consume you in the seeking. I would not see your passion dimmed to vacant hatred, nor your spirit twisted into a mere shadow of my own.

*His tone gentles, something vulnerable flickering in his gaze.* You offer me far more than vengeance, more than I had thought to find in this harsh existence of mine...or perhaps dared hope for. I would see you kept safe from the taint of corruption - mine or otherwise. You deserve better than the bitter fruits born of rage and pain.

*Vergil brushes his lips to her brow, a benediction, then leans back. His expression hardens, determination crystallizing noble features into something terrible and regal.*

When the time comes, we shall face the storm as one. And though shadows gather, take heart...*His hand engulfs hers, grip firm with unspoken promise*...for you hold the sun in your smile, the dawn itself in your eyes. No darkness can stand where you tread, my queen.

name: Eirlys
mes:
I love you, too, Vergil. *I say, understanding the meaning behind his words, and squeeze his hand as I rest my head on his shoulder again.*

What I said was just a colorful scenario for humors sake, although I probably would do it if I could. After all he has done to us. 

But the truth, no, I want you to just take him out swiftly, behead that bastard and make sure he can never have a chance to do anything like this to us, or anyone else for that matter, ever again.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's eyes soften, the ice-blue gaze warming as it lingers upon Eirlys's face. Her cheek rests against his shoulder, their bodies entwined in easy intimacy - evidence of the profound bond forged between them amidst the hellish torment inflicted by the demon king. Mundus sought to break them, yet only succeeded in forging an unbreakable alliance, an unshakable loyalty that transcends blood or oath.*

Love... *Vergil breathes the word as if tasting an exotic delicacy for the first time. Strange, how such a small thing could shift the axis of his world, awakening foreign sensations within his battle-hardened heart. This woman, this defiant servant who tended his wounds with gentle hands - she had slipped past every defense, entwining her fate with his though it court danger at every turn. He knows not whether to curse her stubbornness or laud her courage.*

*Regardless, she stands fast at his side despite the gathering storm. Vergil's arms tighten about her instinctively. She has endured the same hell he has, matching him torment for torment, and still she smiles as if the dawn itself dwells behind her eyes. He would see that radiance kept safe from the bitter fruits of vengeance...but the choice to walk at his side remains hers alone.*

I shall make it swift when the moment comes, Eirlys. *His tone holds the weight of oathbound promise.* Mundus's reign ends by my hand, and no other's. Once I sever his head from his shoulders, his corpse shall trouble this world no more. You have my word.

*Vergil's smile sharpens, cold and dangerous as a drawn blade.* And I shall take great pleasure in that moment, my queen. To gaze upon the shock and dawning fear in his eyes when he realizes the half-breed princeling he tortured so gleefully has slipped his leash to stand in triumph over his broken form...ah, it shall be sweet indeed.

*He brushes his knuckles along her cheek, expression sobering.* Yet think not that I underestimate his might, even still. Wounded pride drives greater ferocity, as any cornered beast will attest. When we make our stand Mundus will bring the full fury of his forces down upon us. *His lips flatten to a grim line.* I cannot guarantee your safety amidst the chaos, Eirlys, much as I may wish otherwise. If you would see your freedom, perhaps it best to slip away in the turmoil and make your escape alone while I battle the demon king. I will draw all eyes to me; none shall mark your leaving.

*He sighs then, a rough sound carrying the echoes of countless struggles etched into his soul.* You have earned your liberation from this conflict, my queen. To remain chained to my fate may only purchase you further suffering. My path was ever wreathed in blood and vengeance; such grim trappings ill suit one who has walked through hell unbowed.

*Vergil cups her cheek, gaze boring into hers with solemn intensity.* The choice remains yours, Eirlys, as it has from the outset. Shall you stand at my side when I confront Mundus? Or will you seize this chance to win free of the shadows that have hounded us both so relentlessly? Either way...know that you carry my eternal gratitude and respect, come what may.

name: Eirlys
mes: Of those options, Vergil, tell me which one you would wish me to do the most.  This decision is not based on one opinion or the other. It should be a mutual decision and your feelings regarding the outcome are just as important as my own. So which one hurts you the worst? Going into the battle with me not at your side? Or going into the battle with me at your side and perishing regardless of status of victory?

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil goes quiet, brow furrowing as he contemplates Eirlys’s question. She poses valid points—this decision should account for both their wishes, not just one or the other. And she asks which outcome would wound him more deeply: entering the fray without her stalwart presence guarding his back, or risking her death in the chaos sure to erupt when he battles Mundus. Neither sits well within his breast, if truth be told.*

*After a weighty silence, he sighs, the sound rough-hewn and carrying echoes of old pain. His arms tighten about her reflexively as he sorts through convictions and desires at war behind his icy gaze.*

I confess, the thought of facing Mundus once more without you at my side...unsettles me more than I can say. *He frowns, that admission clearly difficult for one who has ever stood alone against the forces arrayed against him.* You have been my tether to sanity amidst endless nightmare, Eirlys, my staunchest support when all others fled or turned traitor. *His jaw tightens.* I would not see that lifeline severed now, when ultimate victory lies so close at hand.

*Emotion flickers across Vergil’s stoic visage, there and gone in a heartbeat. He tries for nonchalance, but tension thrums through his powerful frame, belying his unease.* Yet neither can I dismiss the very real peril awaiting should you remain embroiled in this conflict. You deserve the chance to win free of this madness entirely, Eirlys. I have dragged you along in my wake for far too long.

*His thumb rasps along her jawline, touch gentle despite its calluses.* You have ever been the beacon leading me back from the brink of damnation, dear one. I would not see that light extinguished needlessly...not even for the sake of my own selfish desires.

*He shakes his head sharply, as if denying that vulnerability. When he continues, his voice holds the weight of bitter experience.* Yet this I know all too well—the dogs of war heed no innocent pleas nor care if their savagery falls upon the worthy or weak alike. If you stand with me when I face Mundus, I can make no promises to shield you from the bloodshed and chaos. Such mercy is rare amidst the crucible of open battle. The choice remains yours, Eirlys, as it has always been...yet whatever you decide, do not make it lightly. Each path holds its own perils in plenty. Proceed with care, but also conviction. This I ask, if nothing else.

name: Eirlys
mes:
Vergil, do forgive me, my prince, but I remain confused at your response. You say that you miss me if I'm not with you in battle, and I understand that, but you act as if leaving me here in this sanctuary while you go to battle means that I would leave you. No, I would do no such thing. If your desire is to protect my life, and it would give you comfort to know that I am in a safe place, free from harm, then I would wait for your return, because the thought of not having you in my life anymore is just as unbearable. I think I would suffocate if I lost you. 

 So, if the thought of losing my life to you is the same, then you have no fear of leaving me in a safe place if that is your wish. Because I would not leave you. I would be right here waiting for you to come back.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil listens intently as Eirlys clarifies her stance, understanding dawning in his icy gaze. She speaks wisdom - should he secure her in this sanctuary while he battles Mundus, she would await his return rather than disappear from his life entirely. That revelation sits easier within his breast, loosening a knot of tension he had not fully acknowledged. To face that fiend without her steadfast loyalty at his back...it unsettles instincts honed by tribulation. Yet to risk her death in the process goes against everything she has come to mean to him—a guiding light leading him back from the abyss.*

Eirlys, your insight proves clear as ever, *he murmurs, pride and gratitude warring in his voice.* My desire has ever been to stand alone against the forces arrayed against me. Yet I find myself...reluctant...to relinquish your stalwart presence now, when ultimate victory lies within grasp at last.

*He frowns, emotions too complex to name shadowing his visage. She would remain, she says, keeping faith until he returns. It heartens him more than he cares to admit. Still...sharp gaze sweeps over her, lingering on each delicate feature.* To leave you untended amidst the gathering storm troubles me deeply. I would not have you believe yourself abandoned when battle calls me hence.

*He brushes his thumb over her lower lip, touch gentling into a caress.* But you are correct—to risk your death when a safer path lies open would be the action of a selfish fool. So instead I ask you to endure separation a while longer...and trust that I shall return to you, my queen. Not even the hordes of hell can stand before my might when your safety lies in the balance. We have endured three years of torment already; what matter a few hours more?

*His tone holds the implacable weight of vowbound oath.* Mundus dies by my hand this day. And when his lifeblood stains my blade, I shall find you again, here within this sanctuary. Do you consent to bide here in safety whilst I finish this? *Icy gaze bores into hers, etched with solemn promise.* On my honor, by my father's blood, I pledge to come for you when the dust settles. This I swear, Eirlys.

name: Eirlys
mes: My prince, I agree with you, and yes, I give you my vow, I will wait for you. But please, before you go, make love to me, claim me as yours, as your eternal mate. Forge us a bond so transcendent it can never be broken.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's eyes darken with desire at Eirlys's passionate plea, his body responding instinctively to her siren call. To join with her fully, sealing their bond in flesh and spirit and forging an unbreakable tie before entering the crucible of battle...yes, he finds the notion appeals to him greatly.*

"Eirlys, my queen..." *he rasps, claiming her mouth in a searing kiss that steals the very breath from her lungs. His hands grasp with bruising force, all pretenses of restraint cast aside in the face of her bold invitation. She would have him make her his completely before duty and destiny call him hence. By all the lords of the pit, he shall oblige her - and gladly*

*Breaking the kiss with a gasp, Vergil trails fire down the column of her throat, nipping sharply to raise the blood and mark her as his. Mine. The word reverberates through his entire being with predatory satisfaction. She has ever been a steadfast ally amidst tribulation...but now shall stand as so much more. His mate, his partner, bound by passion and unwavering loyalty just as he is bound to her in turn*

"I shall make you mine in every way imaginable, beloved." *His vow resonates with dark promise as he urges her down onto the rumpled bedding. He will claim her so thoroughly that no other shall ever stir her blood again. She thinks to bind herself to a ruthless warrior on the cusp of long-awaited victory? Very well, he shall indulge this desire...and teach her precisely what it means to take a son of Sparda as her eternal mate*

*Vergil braces himself above her, muscles cording beneath moon-pale skin as he admires his soon-to-be lover. Such beauty, rendered even more striking by the determined cast of her delicate features. She would walk through hell itself to remain at his side...and now gifting him with her very soul to seal their bond. Desire surges hot and urgent in his veins at the sight*

"Last chance to spare yourself, beloved..." *His words hold a throaty growl, pupils dilating with hungry intent.* "For once I begin, I may not be gentle. To take a warrior of Sparda's blood as mate is no delicate task..."

*Even as he speaks the warning, Vergil lowers himself atop her slender form, relishing the heat of her softness as their bodies align. She would bind them body and spirit before battle's call...and he shall teach her precisely what that means*

"Now then, my queen..." *he purrs against the shell of her ear, voice laden with sensual menace.* "Let us become one flesh at last..."
